header.title: Mother ‘killed baby by rubbing heroin on her gums to get her to sleep’
header.postText: A mother killed her baby daughter by rubbing heroin on her gums to get her to sleep, court papers say.', 'Kimberly Nelligan, 33, is said to have used the substance on one year-old Jordy at least 15 times before the infant died in October 2018.', 'The little girl was found dead at her home in Bangor, Maine, by emergency responders, with Nelligan arrested in connection with her death on Monday. Nelligan gave the finger to reporters during a foul-tempered court appearance on Wednesday.', 'A coroner later determined that Jordy had synthetic opioid fentanyl in her system, a powerful painkiller than is often mixed with heroin and which is 50 times more powerful. Their report determined that Jordy had ingested the drug, and said this could have happened if it had been rubbed around the inside of her mouth.', 'Despite the severity of the allegations facing Nelligan, she posted a Facebook photo of drugs and drug paraphernalia in June this year, with the caption ‘Yay buddy.’', 'The mother also condemned Ohio cheerleader Skylar Richardson, 20, who was cleared of murdering her baby but convicted of burying the girl’s corpse last week.', 'Nelligan wrote on Facebook: ‘Kills me i would do anything to have my baby back stupid bitch she is.’', 'The mother reportedly confessed to using heroin once a week in the months leading up to Jordy’s death, with the child’s dad telling cops he’d seen Nelligan rub it on the little girl’s gums.', 'Nelligan is said to have told that unnamed man she’d done the same to her older children to get them to sleep, and added: ‘You know I didn’t hurt our daughter on purpose.’', 'She has been charged with child endangerment, and is also set to face a charge of being in possession of a Schedule Z drug.
header.socioLingVar: Gender - General,Age - Youngsters,Behavioural Addiction - Drugs,Physical Identity - Physical (and Mental) Impairments,Nationality - General,Ethnicity - Native-American, Ideological and Political Identity - General,Age - General

commentThread.commentText: Um this is all pot stuff which is legal in Maine and that she had a prescription for. I get the intent but hate to break it to people that lots of parents smoke and this has nothing to do with the drugs involved in the case.

replies.commentText: Brandi Marie Harriman have you even read it?

Pamela D Allan read it? I know the whole case, I know the person. Yes, I know this is horrible and regardless of whether it's pot or not in the picture she shouldn't have it all laying there in the open but the pot is irrelevant to this case is all I am saying. I smoke for anxiety and I don't smoke around kids buy I will say that I know many that smoke that are not impaired and can still perform any duty necessary. Pot and pot paraphernalia are not the issues here. Her drug problem with opiates is the problem here. Her recklessness and irresponsibility is the problem here. I have read many articles and I also know her and I don't even know why she had custody of that kid to begin with if she wasn't going to even attempt to get her act together. She gives parents in recovery that actually try to do the right thing a bad name. She has other kids this will hurt but at least they will be alive. I can tell by your response you don't agree with my comment and that is absolutely fine. I am not standing up for her, I am simply saying that I expected a photo of actual paraphernalia like baggies, needles and straws, not stuff for marijuana that she had a legal prescription for.
Brandi Marie Harriman I understand what you are saying and whole hearted I agree xXx

Brandi Marie Harriman  the problem is, that it shows that the person had a drug problem. It would be the same if they showed smoking or drinking. It's showing an addiction problem. It doesnt matter if its legal or not.
Are you RETARDED!!!!!!’

are you a dick head as well as a junkie

Do you really think it matters? I didn't look at the 'drug paraphernalia', but even if it is not fentanyl it is hardly OK to have it out around a baby.

Legal prescription or not who would take a photo of that and slap on social media AFTER their baby has died? Then she had the nerve to make a remark about Skylar Richardson and say she would give anything to have her baby back? People want to get on here and actually go back and forth because the article said paraphernalia and it's just weed? Let's remember what this is really about. A baby died because she had a very powerful drug in her system!!!! Pisses me off trash like this can have kids yet those who would love to have a baby can't
Brandi Marie Harriman are u serious rn???????

commentThread.commentText: Charlene Fiander
I hate it that junkies keep their children. They should be removed at birth.

replies.commentText: II wholeheartedly agree with you

If a child is positive for drugs at birth they ARE removed from the parent.  They have to prove over time that they're clean before they can get the child back. The problem is when the parents start doing drugs after the child is home. In this case the father should have stepped in and protected his child. Doesn't matter what the courts do now, the child is dead. Hopefully the parents will never takea free breath again.
